validationErrors.email: * Please provide a valid email address

consentScreen.validationError: * Please provide a valid email address
consentScreen.name: Please enter your full name
consentScreen.description: Please read and accept the consent form by scrolling to the bottom and clicking "I consent"
consentScreen.consentFormHeader:
**UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
CONSENT FORM: Ages 18 and up
ASSENT FORM:  Ages 13-17
SEATTLE FLU STUDY**

Researchers:
Helen Y. Chu, MD, MPH, Assistant Professor of Medicine, (206) 897-5318 (University of Washington)
Janet. A Englund, MD, Professor of Pediatric Infectious Diseases (Seattle Children’s Hospital)
Michael Boeckh, MD, PhD, Professor of Medicine (Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center)
consentScreen.consentFormText:
We are asking you to be in a research study. This form gives you information to help you decide whether or not to be in the study. Being in the study is voluntary. Please read this carefully. You may ask any questions about the study. Then you can decide whether or not you want to be in the study.

This form also serves as an assent form for individuals ages 13-17. This means that if you choose to take part in this research study, you would sign this form to confirm your choice. Your parent or legally-authorized representative would also need to give their permission and sign this form for you to join the study.

This form is also used for parents and legally-authorized representatives of subjects to provide permission to the research team for individuals who are not capable of providing permission themselves. In such cases, the term “you” refers to the subject or your child.

**PURPOSE OF THE STUDY**

Colds are common in children and adults, and can cause a runny nose, cough, or trouble breathing. We want to understand how people get sick with these cold germs and how they spread from person to person. Once we understand how the germs start and spread, we can have a better plan to prevent them from making people sick.

**STUDY PROCEDURES**

We are testing children and adults who might have a cold. We are inviting you to participate because you have the symptoms of a cold. This study involves:

1. Answering questions about your health, who you are around, and your living situation. We think these questions will take about 15 minutes. You may choose not to answer any question that you do not want to.
2. Doing a swab of your nose to look for germs. This will only take about 5 seconds.

This study does not replace care you would receive from your doctor, and your participation is voluntary. The only test for this study is the swab of your nose.

**RISKS, STRESS, OR DISCOMFORT**

We do not expect serious side effects from this study. Getting the nasal swab may cause mild discomfort, watery eyes, or sneezing. Some of the questions that we might ask you are sensitive and may make you feel uncomfortable. You do not have to answer any question that you do not want to. There is a risk that your privacy could be breached. We will do everything that we can to make sure that this does not happen.

**BENEFITS OF THE STUDY**

This study will not benefit you directly. It may help others in the future by learning what germs make people sick.

**SOURCE OF FUNDING**

The University of Washington is receiving financial support from an anonymous donor.

**CONFIDENTIALITY OF RESEARCH INFORMATION**

Your record will be kept secret. You will not be identified in any report about this study. All records will be kept in a secure location at the University of Washington. Your study record will never be used against you.

Government and university staff sometimes review studies such as this one to make sure they are being done safely and legally. If a review of this study takes place, your records may be examined. The reviewers will protect your privacy. The study records will never be used against you.

Washington State law requires that we report certain conditions to local public health jurisdictions or the Department of Health. If your sample tests positive for one of these conditions, a local health jurisdiction or the Department of Health might contact you with more questions. They will keep your information secret.

**SPECIMEN BANKING**

Storing samples so researchers can use them in the future is called “banking.” Researchers also bank information and samples so they can share it with other researchers.

The information and/or samples that we obtain from you for this study might be used for future studies. We may remove anything that might identify you from the information and samples. If we do so, that information and samples may then be used for future research studies or given to another researcher without getting additional permission from you. It is also possible that in the future we may want to use or share study information that might identify you. If we do, a review board will decide whether or not we need to get additional permission from you.

By signing this consent form, you are giving your permission for these researchers to use your sample for future use.

**OTHER INFORMATION**

You may refuse to participate and you are free to leave this study at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled (such as your normal medical care). By signing this form, you do not give up any of your rights.

If you join this study, you will receive a $10 gift card for each nose swab that we collect. You will receive the gift card the same day that we collect the sample.

**RESEARCH-RELATED INJURY**

If you think you have been harmed from being in this research, contact Dr.Helen Y. Chu at (206) 897-5318. The University of Washington does not normally provide compensation for harm except through its discretionary program for medical industry. However, the law may allow you to seek other compensation if the harm is the fault of the researchers. You do not waive any right to seek payment by signing this consent form.

**Subject's statement**

This study has been explained to me. I volunteer to take part in this research. I have had a chance to ask questions. If I have questions later about the research, or if I have been harmed by participating in this study, I can contact one of the researchers listed on the first page of this consent form. If I have questions about my rights as a research subject, I can call the Human Subjects Division at (206) 543-0098 or call collect at (206) 221-5940. I will receive a copy of this consent form.
consentScreen.privacyNotice: We will not share your personal information with any third party or for purposes other than this study.

surveyTitle.consentEmail: Email me a copy of this consent form
surveyTitle.whatSymptoms: Which of the following were present during your illness?
surveyTitle.symptomsStart: How long ago did symptoms start?
surveyTitle.symptomsLast48: Were these symptoms present in the last 48 hours?
surveyTitle.inContact: In the past week, have you been in contact with a person who seemed to have a cold?
surveyTitle.youngChildren: In the past week, have you been in contact with any children under five years old for over an hour?
surveyTitle.householdChildren: Are there any children under 18 years old in your household?
surveyTitle.childrenWithChildren: *Do any children in your household attend a school, childcare setting or play group with at least three other children for three or more hours per week?
surveyTitle.peopleInHousehold: How many people live in your household (including you)?
surveyTitle.bedrooms: How many bedrooms are in your home?
surveyTitle.medicalCondition: Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have one of the following medical conditions?
surveyTitle.fluShot: Did you get a flu shot in the last year?
surveyTitle.fluShotDate: If yes, what was the date of your flu shot?
surveyTitle.householdTobacco: Does anyone in your household smoke tobacco?
surveyTitle.interfering: Is your illness preventing you from going to work or school, going to social events, or exercising/working out?
surveyTitle.antibiotics: Are you currently taking antibiotics or antivirals prescribed by a doctor for this illness?
surveyTitle.assignedSex: What was your assigned sex at birth?
surveyTitle.race: How would you describe your race?
surveyTitle.blueLine: Do you see a blue line in the middle of the test strip?
surveyTitle.redLine: Is there a red line on your test strip?
surveyTitle.firstTestFeedback: Do you feel you performed all the steps in the flu test correctly?
surveyTitle.secondTestFeedback: How do you feel you performed the second test?

surveyDescription.addressDesc: Please provide a mailing address so we may mail a flu test kit for you to run at home.
surveyDescription.selectMostApplicable: Please select the most applicable option
surveyDescription.symptomsStart: Select the time frame that best applies
surveyDescription.fatigue: Feeling tired or more tired than usual
surveyDescription.symptomsSeverity: Select the level of discomfort you felt
surveyDescription.medicalConditions: Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have one of the following medical conditions?
surveyDescription.blueLine: The line may be faint, but as long as you see it you can answer Yes to the question.
surveyDescription.optInForMessages: We will have information to share regarding the outcome of this study and we will be expanding the study next flu season. Please select the items below we can contact you about, or if you're not interested, just click Continue.

symptomsScreen.nextStep: The next step is to obtain your consent to participate. Please read the consent form carefully, and click "I consent" to continue

welcomeScreen.description: We know you aren't feeling well right now. Thank you for participating even when you're ill.

whyScreen.description: The goal of this program is to understand if people who are sick should test themselves at home for the flu using a new test. Although you won't learn whether or not you have the flu as part of this study, you'll play an important role in helping find ways to manage it in the future.

whatScreen.description: We need to ask a few questions about you and the symptoms you're feeling. In addition, you will need to provide your home or mailing address so we can send the flu test kit to you.

ageIneligibleScreen.description: We're sorry, but this study is aimed at adults 18 years and older.

symptomsIneligibleScreen.description: At this time your symptoms do not meet the criteria to continue. If your symptoms change, you can open this app again on a different day.
symptomsIneligibleScreen.disclaimer: This is not medical advice. We suggest you consult your doctor for your illness as you normally would.

consentIneligibleScreen.description: We're sorry, but we need a signed consent form in order for you to participate in the study. If you change your mind, click the "Back to consent" button below.

confirmationScreen.confirmed: Thank you! Your flu test kit was ordered.
confirmationScreen.description: You are now enrolled in the study. The flu test kit should arrive at your home within the next 1-2 days.

pushNotificationsScreen.pushNotifications: May we send you push notifications?
pushNotificationsScreen.description: We'll only notify you of content interesting and relevant to you, such as: shipping status of your kit, gift card details at the end of the study, and flu information.

instructionsScreen.instructions: When your kit arrives, grab your phone.
instructionsScreen.description: Open the Flu@Home app and it will tell you what to do next.

extraInfoScreen.extraInfo: Interested in sharing this or learning more?

welcomeBackScreen.description: Sorry, we know you're feeling bad and appreciate your participation. Before we get started, make yourself comfortable. Today you'll be completing two tests, which allows us to double check your results. The whole process should take about 20 total minutes.

whatsNextScreen.description: Both tests involve taking nose swabs, then returning them by mail using a shipping label provided in the box. We will also ask some questions about your illness. As a thank you for all your help, we'll email you a $50 Amazon gift card.

beforeScreen.washStep: Please wash your hands with soap and water. before proceeding with the test.
beforeScreen.waterStep: Please get yourself some water and use the restroom first. It is important you stay beside the kit until everything is done.
beforeScreen.flatStep: Find a flat surface where you can place the kit. Be sure it is away from pets and children.

scanInstructionsScreen.description: First, we'd like you to scan the bar code found on the inside cover of your box. To do that, we'll need to access your phone's camera.
scanInstructionsScreen.tips:
**Tips:**

Hold the camera so the bar code is in the middle of the camera.

If it's too dark, please adjust your lighting.

scanScreen.cameraWarning: "Flu@Home" would like to access your camera
scanScreen.cameraAccess: Camera access needed to scan barcodes.

scanConfirmationScreen.description: Thank you. Your barcode was successfully scanned. This will help us know the kit came from you when you return it to us.
scanConfirmationScreen.nextStep: Next up, you'll be performing two tests with your kit and answering some questions about your symptoms.

manualEntryScreen.desc: Enter the 8-character code found below the barcode symbol on the inside cover of your flu kit box.
manualEntryScreen.tips:
**Tips:**
Find the bar code inside your box.
Look for the 8-character code directly below the symbol.

manualConfirmationScreen.description: Thank you. Your barcode was successfully entered. This will help us know the kit came from you when you return it to us.
manualConfirmationScreen.nextStep: Next up, you'll be performing two tests with your kit and answering some questions about your symptoms.

testInstructionsScreen.title: How the test works
testInstructionsScreen.description: We'll walk you through all the necessary steps in the following screens--from doing the tests using the items in the kit to shipping it all back and getting your gift card.

swabScreen.title: Begin the first test
swabScreen.description:
Open box 1 and remove all the items.

Take out the small tube, remove the stopper, and stand up the tube in the perforated hole marked "small" on the box. **Keep** the stopper for later.

swabPrepScreen.title: Prepare tube
swabPrepScreen.description:
Carefully twist open the saline (salt water) vial and squeeze the liquid into the sample tube. Do so slowly and carefully so all the liquid gets into the tube.

Next, remove the nasal swab from the wrapper. Be careful not to drop it, and only touch the handle, not the tip.

mucusScreen.title: Collect mucus from nose
mucusScreen.description: Gently insert the swab into one nostril about 1/2 to 3/4 of an inch. Next, gently insert the same swab into the other nostril and rub it around the same way.

swabInTubeScreen.title: Put swab in tube
swabInTubeScreen.description:
Place the swab into the tube sitting in box [circle 1]. Make sure the swab tip is touching the bottom of the tube and stir it around 4 times.

Click "Start Timer" below. The swab needs to stay in the tube for one minute.

firstTimerScreen.title: Time Remaining: **{{time}}**
firstTimerScreen.tip:
**DID YOU KNOW?**

If you are sick with flu symptoms, CDC recommends that you stay home for at least 24 hours after your fever is gone, except to get medical care or for other necessities.

firstTimerDoneScreen.title: Timer finished
firstTimerDoneScreen.tip:
**DID YOU KNOW?**

Everyone six months of age and older should get a flu vaccine each year before flu activity begins in their community. CDC recommends getting vaccinated by the end of October.

removeSwabFromTubeScreen.title: Remove swab from tube
removeSwabFromTubeScreen.description:
Carefully rub the tip of it the swab against the wall of the tube as you pull it out. You want to squeeze as much liquid out of the swab as possible.

Throw the swab in the trash. You won't need it again.

openTestStripScreen.title: Open test strip
openTestStripScreen.description: Inside the same box [circle 1] you'll find a test strip in a foil pouch. Open this package, being careful to ONLY hold it at the very top.

stripInTubeScreen.title: Put test strip in tube
stripInTubeScreen.description:
The arrows on the test strip should be **pointing down** as you lower it into the tube. Make sure the strip is touching the bottom.

Leave the test strip in the tube. It needs to be there for at least 10 minutes. In the meantime, please answer some questions so we can better understand how this illness has affected you.

surveyCoverScreen.title: Questions for you
surveyCoverScreen.description: The strip needs to stay in the tube for at least 10 minutes. While we're waiting, please answer some questions for us. We'll tell you when to take the strip out of the tube.

surveyScreen.title: Symptoms Survey
surveyScreen.description: Questions marked with an * are required.
surveyScreen.expoDesc: In the next section, the questions are going to be about being in contact with people who seem to have a cold. In contact means being within six feet of them for at least two minutes or physical contact for any amount of time.
surveyScreen.expoRef: For reference, six feet is about the distance between you and someone sitting two rows ahead of you on the bus.
surveyScreen.generalDesc: Next, we'd like to ask you some questions about your general health.

thankYouSurveyScreen.title: Thank you!
thankYouSurveyScreen.desc: We know you're still feeling crummy and truly appreciate your time. Your answers to our questions, along with the tests you're doing today, help us understand many factors related to your illness. Click Continue and we'll check on your test strip.

testStripReadyScreen.title: Remove test strip
testStripReadyScreen.desc: Please remove the test strip from the tube and place it flat on the middle of box [circle 1]. Try not to cover the other hole in the box--you'll be using that in a moment.

testStripTimerScreen.title: Time Remaining: **{{time}}**
testStripTimerScreen.desc: **Please wait for the timer to end.**

finishTubeScreen.title: Finish with the tube
finishTubeScreen.description: Put the stopper back on the sample tube you just took the test strip out of. You'll be sending this back to us. We'll walk you through packaging steps shortly.

lookAtStripScreen.title: Look at the test strip
lookAtStripScreen.description: We are going to ask you a few questions about what you see on the test strip. Please try to look at it in good lighting. Answer YES if you see any of the lines mentioned, even if they are very faint. There is no right or wrong answer here, we're just interested in knowing what you see.

testStripSurveyScreen.title: What do you see?
testStripSurveyScreen.desc: Hold the test strip with the arrows pointing down when answering the following questions.

pictureInstructionsScreen.title: Take a photo of the strip
pictureInstructionsScreen.desc:
We know that was a lot of steps and appreciate you hanging in there with us.

Next, take a photo of the test strip. When you're ready, click the Continue button to use the camera.

testStripCameraScreen.title: Place test strip in the middle of the screen with arrows pointing down.
testStripCameraScreen.description:
Tap the screen to focus the image, and try to use good lighting.
When ready, tap the round button to take your photo.

testStripConfirmationScreen.title: Photo captured!
testStripConfirmationScreen.desc: Thank you for continuing with the test. Next, we'll get our first test items put away.

cleanFirstTestScreen.title: Clean up the first test
cleanFirstTestScreen.step1: Inside box [circle 1] with the two holes, find the medium-sized bag with a barcode on it.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step2: Put the test strip inside this bag and close it.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step3: Open bag [circle 2] and lay its contents in front of you.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step4: Place the test strip bag and the tube you already used into bag [circle 2]. Please ensure the stopper is tight on the tube.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step5: Inside box [circle 1] with the two holes, find the medium-sized bag with a barcode on it.
cleanFirstTestScreen.step6: Keep the box in front of you. You'll need it for the next test.

firstTestFeedbackScreen.title: Nice job with the first test! One more to go.

beginSecondTestScreen.title: Begin the second test
beginSecondTestScreen.description:
This test has fewer steps than the first one and some steps are different, so please read carefully.

Bag [circle 2] had a large tube in it and another nose swab. Place the large tube in the perforated hole in the box so it's standing up.

prepSecondTestScreen.title: Prepare for the test
prepSecondTestScreen.description: Open the swab package. Be careful to not drop it, and only touch the handle--not the tip of the swab.

mucusSecondScreen.title: Collect mucus from nose
mucusSecondScreen.description:
Now you'll repeat the same instructions you followed during the first test:

Gently insert the swab into one nostril about 1/2 to 3/4 of an inch. Rub it around the inside wall of the nostril four times. Next, gently insert the same swab into the other nostril and rub it around the same way.

swabInTubeSecondScreen.title: Put swab in tube
swabInTubeSecondScreen.description: Place the swab into the tube and make sure the tip is touching the bottom. (No need to add saline as you did with test 1). Stir it around four times. Leave the swab in the tube and put the stopper back on the top.

cleanSecondTestScreen.title: Clean up the second test
cleanSecondTestScreen.description:
Put the larger tube into the same bag [circle 2] as the other items to be returned.

Place the absorbent material that was originally in bag [circle 2] back into that bag.

secondTestFeedbackScreen.title: Nice job with the second (and final) test!

packingScreen.title: Packing things up
packingScreen.description: You will be using the same box that was shipped to you to send everything back. Open bag [circle 3]. Inside, you'll find everything you need to pack up your box.

stickersScreen.title: Put stickers on the box
stickersScreen.description:
Apply the return mailing label to the outside of the box, OVER the label with your address on it.

Add the UN3373 stickers to the side of the box. This sticker just means there are samples inside.

secondBagScreen.title: Put bag [circle 2] in the box
secondBagScreen.description:
Bag [circle 2] should have the small tube, the big tube, a bag with the test strip, and some absorbent material (just in case anything spills in transit).

Close bag [circle 2] using the sticky strip on the top of the bag and ensure the bubble wrap is still in the box.

You can throw out the rest of the items (below), or put them in the box if it's easier:

- Swab used in first test
- Packaging for both swabs and the test strip [see comment]
- Bag [circle 3]
- Box with two holes in it

tapeBoxScreen.title: Tape up the box
tapeBoxScreen.description: Adhere the provided tape lengthwise to the long seam of the box where there is an opening.

shipBoxScreen.title: Shipping your box
shipBoxScreen.description:
Now that your box is ready to go, please mail it as soon as possible.

If you don’t have an outgoing mail service to leave the package with and need to drop it off, locate a nearby USPS Post Office or other facility below.

schedulePickupScreen.title: Schedule a pickup
schedulePickupScreen.description: You will be directed to the USPS site where you can enter the pickup address. The mailperson can pick up the package directly from your doorstep while on their typical route. Indicate the following items on the form:
schedulePickupScreen.rule2: Pick-up during your **regular mail delivery** so there is no additional charge.  The weight of the package is **1 lb**.

giftcardDetailsScreen.title: Gift card details
giftcardDetailsScreen.descriptionWithEmail: For all your hard work, we'd we would like to send you a $50 Amazon gift card via email.
giftcardDetailsScreen.description: For all your hard work, we'd like to send you a $50 Amazon gift card via email.
giftcardDetailsScreen.optOut: No, I do not want a gift card.
giftcardDetailsScreen.explanation: We need your email to send you your gift card. We won't send you any other emails unless you say it's OK.
giftcardDetailsScreen.privacyNotice: We will not share this with any third party or for purposes other than this study.

emailOptInScreen.title: Opt-in for messages
emailOptInScreen.description: We will have information to share regarding the outcome of this study and will be expanding the study next flu season. Please select the items below we can contact you about, or if you're not interested, just click Continue.

thanksScreen.title: Thank you!
thanksScreen.description: Your participation could help us stop the spread of the flu, lead to personalized treatments, smarter prevention, and a safer and healthier world for all of us.
thanksScreen.disclaimer: Please remember, the results of these tests are experimental and are not to be used as medical care. Consult your doctor as your normally would for your sickness.

links.recommendLink: Recommend Flu@Home to a friend who's not feeling well
links.learnLink: Learn more about this flu study
links.searchMapsLink: Search Maps for urgent care clinics nearby
links.medLink: Find a nearby clinic or physician

surveyOption.sendCopyOfMyConsent: Send me a copy of my consent
surveyOption.askAboutMyIllness: To ask me questions about my illness/cold
surveyOption.learnAboutStudy: To learn more about this study and related topics
surveyOption.fatigue: Feeling tired or more tired than usual
surveyOption.noContactUnderFive: No contact with children under 5 yrs old
surveyOption.sendMeStudy: Send me the study outcome report
surveyOption.contactMeForFollowUpStudy: Contact me in a couple months to participate in a follow-up study (Note: You will be compensated for your time)

surveyButton.noRed: No, there are no red lines
surveyButton.yesAboveBelowBlue: Yes, above and below the blue line
surveyButton.yesOneRed: Yes there is one red line
surveyButton.yesTwoRed: Yes there are two red lines
surveyButton.easyCorrect: It was easy to follow and I think I completed the test correctly
surveyButton.confusingCorrect: It was a little confusing but I think I did the test correctly
surveyButton.confusingNotCorrect: It was very confusing and I'm not sure I completed the test correctly
surveyButton.incorrect: During the test, I realized I did something incorrectly
